column4: Hi, i was wondering if anyone could give me a hand, when i use the "update manager" i get the following error message "Not all updates can be installed" "Run a partial upgrade, to install as many updates as possible"
What would a partial upgrade be ? would that upgrade me from 10.4 LTS to the latest non LTS ?
anyone lol ? :P
ok, thanks stefg, I will try now shcherbak
i get "the following packages have been kept back"
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade and "The following packages will be upgraded" "linux-libc-dev"
i got a lot of hits and a few "ign"
im guessing it ignored some
ign is normal
usually not recommended
ooops - we contradicted each other - I never tried that, was always warned off
what I did in such cases was sudo aptitude safe-upgrade
Good luck :-)
are you still there ?
yes
that means one upgrade was not possible, but you should be fine for now, did you enable any ppa s?
then that *could* be the reason, try, disable it and run the update/safe-upgrade sequence again
no problem, we all learn :)
yes, that should work
i get "0 packages upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 1 not upgraded." with safeupgrade after i disabled my PPA for the graphics
I think this is the problem this is displayed also"The following packages have been kept back: winetricks{a}"
did it tell you which package was not upgraded (its a long time back for me)
